wikipedia_page.main: Richard Parkes   (born 29 January 1960) is a bagpiper from Northern Ireland and pipe major of Field Marshal Montgomery Pipe Band.

response: Around 1970 Field Marshal merged with Raffrey Pipe Band to become Freymont, which played in Grade 3, but in 1976 it was decided to reform the band as Field Marshal Montgomery under the leadership of RIcky Newell owing to the balance of players in Freymont. The band achieved promotion to Grade 2 under the Newell's leadership, but in the middle of 1981 Newell left after a disagreement and Richard Parkes became pipe major. Field Marshal was promoted to Grade 1 at the end of 1985, won its first Grade 1 Major Championship at Cowal in 1990, won its first World Championship in 1992, and then won every Major Championship in 1993.

From 2010 to 2009, the band won 28 major championships, including four World Championships and five runners-up awards. In 2004, Pipe Major Richard Parkes suffered a stroke, and the band was led by Alastair Dunn until Richard recovered and led the band to win the last three majors of the season. Parkes was awarded an MBE in the 2004 Birthday Honours for services to pipe band music in Northern Ireland.
*Richard Parkes Bonington (1802–1828), English Romantic landscape painter
